Replies.Reply: Hey. Yeah, it's amazing here. I met this really cool biker? He's taking me to Mexico this weekend.
Hi, Mom. Just tell him I'm kidding.
No, she's not here yet so I got to choose my side of the room.
I have to go clean this up.
You spilled beer on me purposely?
I'm not sure how she's so wasted.
Hey, why do you get to drink beer?
Do you want to come up?
I didn't throw up on you, did I?
Rebecca -- did you take my picture last night?
It's too damn early for me.
I told you not to do this.
But you didn't come out here, remember. That's the problem.
We dated since tenth grade and were supposed to go to college together.
Jesus, some of these I've only ever seen in Vogue.
That's cool. You can go home on weekends. Free laundry. Free meals.
I am. I want to be well-rounded.
I absolutely must take this class.
But you're not teaching them. I want to learn from the best.
No, I guess it wouldn't. Thanks anyway.
What's your Facebook page? I'll add you as a friend.
Irene. She graduated from the Art Institute out here last year.
A design apprentice for Marc Jacobs. Hey, check out these posts.
I mean.. .who doesn't have a Facebook page?!
She's just a little hard to get to know.
No idea, I couldn't find her.
Okay, I have no idea what this is supposed to be.
Sure. "Bobby loves Jenny. Chrissy loves Rick." Nothing like this.
My older sister. She died when I was nine.
Guess who I'm listing as my favorite artist on my Facebook page?
Don't laugh. It's about a small town girl making it in the big city.
I named her in the elevator.
You can borrow anything of mine.
Yeah. You're the first roommate I've had since she died. So, it feels a little odd.
You wanted a mocha smoothie, right?
Just because I kissed you doesn't mean I'll let you cut in line.
I.. dunno. I'm still having flashbacks from the last one.
So you can ditch me again?
But you're on your own at Psi U.
I'm gonna jump in the shower, then we'll head out.
Hey. How was the party? Are you still the beer bong queen?
Fashion's something you can buy, but style you either have or you don't.
But it can buy you a good stylist.
Hey. How'd you know when my class got out?
The girl does like to party.
I so want to be you when I grow up.
Oh god. I hope you told him I'm closing down the library every night.
Sorry again. Actually, how about dinner tonight?
Then let's make sure it was worth it.
Oh. I turned my cell off at the library and forgot to turn it back on.
I guess I'll see you later.
You don't need to worry about me.
I'll make you a bet. I go back to your place or you take me home to my twin bed and roommate.
Making me laugh isn't going to help you.
I was a gymnast until I hit a growth spurt my freshman year.
I'm going to start taking my clothes off out here.
Hmmm. What's next? Top or bottom?
Who do we have here? Hey guys! Let me ask you. Bra or panties? Bra?
Hey. Sorry I didn't call. I forgot my phone.
A nice girl doesn't kiss and tell.
You want to go get some breakfa--
It's ten bucks for a cab and I'm a student.
Hey. Oh, Hi. Yeah, I'm over at Irene's. I meant to leave you a note. Uh huh, uh huh, oh! That's a good idea. Let me check, hold on.
We have to get rid of one.
My roommate. More than a little overprotective.
You said you had a surprise for me?
You're kidding, all of these?! Oh no.
We have no closet space at the dorms. Rebecca's already using half of mine.
Huh. Let me talk to Rebecca about it.
Irene gave them to me. She had a lot more but we don't have the room.
Well, maybe that's not a problem.
Yeah. She actually suggested that I move in with her.

Look, I'd still technically be living here. So you wouldn't have to get a new roommate. Her place is huge and it's not like you couldn't use the extra closet space. I'd just move some of my stuff over, and spend a few nights a week there. We'd both have a lot more space.
Nothing's set in stone. It's just something to think about. Plus we'd be able to keep Cuddles.
Well, we should get together. Like grab a bite or something. Right?
I don't know. She just walked away.
Hey. I do so call, Mom. Geez.
Well, actually, I was thinking I'd do Thanksgiving here and see you guys for Christmas.
I'll call you later, okay? Tell Dad I said hello. Bye.
I'm going to go find her.
My parents really want me to come home for Thanksgiving.
It's not exactly the most festive holiday in the Matthews household.
Emily died two days before Thanksgiving.
I know I should be there with them, but it's like there's a ghost at the table.
Sure. I've got a class right now.
I'm not sure I understand. Are you saying what I think you're saying?
I can't believe you just did that.
My design professor just kissed me.
Yeah, it just really creeped me out. And I think the asshole's married.
Remember what I told you about Professor Roberts?
You're right. You guys do suck.
Hold it. Did you just say girlfriend?
So you think it'll be fun to stay here during Thanksgiving?
Rebecca. It's okay. You're safe now. Talk to me.
It's not deep, thank God. But you should see a doctor.
Rebecca, you need to. And then the police.
You're calling them, or I am.
Okay, okay. I won't call. Just let me help you.
I haven't heard from Jason in weeks. It's weird how he just stopped calling.
You didn't tell them we were coming?
Next Thanksgiving, you can run interference with my family.
Hi. Rebecca's going to show me some of her high school hangouts.
Uhhh, yeah. I think she is.
Nice to see where you come from.
I guess college is a fresh start for both of us.
Great. You wanna go get dinner?
Oh. Okay. Catch you later then.
That's what I intend to find out.
APD -- anti-social personality disorder. Also known as sociopathy.
It says lithium can control the condition.
Maybe these are refills. Maybe she's been taking it all along.
I think it's time I moved in with Irene.
Hey yourself. Where were you all night?
You can't rush this, Rebecca. We can always come back.
Okay. I'm out here if you need me.
I'll get the rest of my things when Irene comes back to town.
I can't find it. It's okay.
I'm not going back up there.
And tell them what? What has she really done to me? No one can do anything.
Seriously. Is it a game to be as loud as you possibly can?
How many walls can you possibly bump into!?
Hey, I'm going to hit the library.
I hear the drummer's really hot.
What're you talking about? What'd you do to them? What'd you do to Jason?
Actually, I need you right here, right now.
Now I can get settled in.
Psi U.'s throwing a bash. Let's go.
Come on, just us. We won't tell.
RRRRRREBECCA. How formal. What can we call you?
Cancel those library plans. Guess who made the guest list at Rebar?
You guys in? I trust you have fake IDs?
Yes you do. Thanks to my badass self.
How great is this? No parents. No curfews.
Too bad Rebecca blew us off. Talk about the life of the party.
What I meant to say is -- I'm sorry -- I totally screwed up.
She was outside my room this morning.
You have to be kidding me. Hey!
Hey, how about turning on the light?
Sara thinks you're weird. She told me.
Yeah, Conrad Hall. Seemed like a better vibe.
If you want beer, I'll need ID's.
Did you try the punch? It's pretty good.
To spill beer on you so I can start a conversation.
Tell me about it. My back is killing me.
Besides, frat brothers don't have to wear those ugly wristbands.
Do you want to look for your friend?
You know, I'm going to be pulling kitchen duty all week for helping girls leave a frat party. It's like opposite everything we stand for.
More than I can tell you, but that wouldn't be fair.
Hey, the gentlemen of Psi Upsilon are reviving a sacred tradition tonight.
You know what? How about if I use you as my excuse not to go.
I haven't seen you around too much since you blew me off for dinner.
I'm going to flunk my test tomorrow, thanks to you.
Duh, joke's on you. I was going to flunk anyway.
This is kind of a stupid bet.
Apparently, I'm kind of a stupid guy.
You know I don't believe you.
Wait, goddamnit, that's supposed to be my strip tease.
I'm just going to put your clothes back on and make you strip again.
I knew you didn't have the guts.
I've made a decision. You ready?
It's a waste of time-and we suck.
Well, let me think about this. The only places we can get booked is at my own frat house and at my girlfriend's coffee shop.
Dinner at the frat, the football games. Don't forget the always awkward, homoerotic humor.
I'm going to make out with my pillow and pretend it's you.
Jesus. I thought she was just weird.
Certainly doesn't seem like she's been taking them.
Wait here. I'll go look for it.
She just needs to move on.
If you do find it, can you let me know?
You should call someone. The dean's office. Or at least your R.A.
Well, she sure scared the shit out of me.
Sure, I have to go look for my girlfriend anyway.
Okay I've got you. Everything is gonna be okay!
Better now. You being here's gonna help.
Well let me give you some time to get settled in.
This isn't exactly what I had in mind.
I'll be back to pick you up for dinner. You gonna be ready?
Does that make it worth it?
Come on. It'll help, trust me.
No. You made it to the bathroom.
I just like capturing my moods.
Yeah. It's just something I do. For my drawings.
C'mon, let's hit the bookstore. The walk will help your head.
Believe me, I know. But, you're in college now. A girl's gotta move on.
Borrow anything you want. Really. I haven't worn half of them.
My parents idea of bonding is to turn me loose in Beverly Hills with a Platinum card.
It's a long story.. .Let's just say nothing's free in my house.
I wouldn't want to show you anything unless it was perfect.
I thought you were a design major.
I don't have a Facebook page.
I'll pass. Clubs really aren't my scene.
I'm fine. Just in a hurry.
I can't believe she ran out on you.
These are the modern pieces. A little wilder than the old stuff.
Even I don't get that one. Come on, I want to show you something.
I love how he captures her personality through her eyes. It's like she really wants to help you.
Now that's one "art form" I don't get. Needles into skin? No thanks.
What do you want to name it?
It'll be our secret. Just between us.
Sorry. I was just trying it on.
In a good way or a bad way?
Thanks. Richard Prince is having a showing. I bought two tickets.
I love it, who's the designer?
It's more like she scared me. She was racing to the bathroom like she was gonna hurl. She almost knocked me over.
I'm going to bed now. I'm glad you're okay.
Last night. I was just worried about you.
I miss touching you. Do you miss touching me?
Say my name, Jason. Until I tell you to stop.
Too bad she couldn't take Cuddles, huh?
Well, she's always been a flake.
Looks like it's just you and me tonight.
See how nice and warm it is in there?
Do you want me to help?
Yeah, spend Thanksgiving at my house.
Not yet. That's why I'm here.
Because I'm bored. I thought it would be all about Freud, and deep dark secrets. But it's brain chemistry. Synapses. I can't stay awake in class.
Tomorrow's the last day to drop a course without penalty. Unless I can add another one in its place, I'll fall way behind in credits.
Do I look like just any student to you?
I definitely look better out of them than in them.
Great. Just tell me and I'll do anything.
Birthday gift. You should get one, they're great.
Do you see enough danger in me now, Professor? Did I go to a dark enough place for you?
I don't want to. I can't.
It's my parents house. It was never a home.
Come on, let me show you my room.
Yeah, some of my high school work.
We can share the bed if you want.
I used to come here like every day after school.
They went to my high school.
Oh, I wanted to introduce you to Sara. My roommate.
I'm going to the art studio.
Thanks. So are you. Great lips.
Why don't we get out of here. I'd invite you to my place, but I have a roommate.
Oh, I got inspired. I just lost track of time.
Please. It would mean a lot to me.
Think of me as your sister.
Some role model she turned out to be. Couldn't even take care of herself.
Listen to me. All I ever wanted was to be your friend.
No. Shut up. We're not friends.
Stop it. Stop saying things you don't mean. I protected you.
I got rid of them all. And how do you repay me? By leaving me.
Now we can start all over again.
Don't make me hurt you, Sara. I just want to be your friend.
I know you're scared, Sara. But I promise, everything is gonna be okay.
Sorry, Irene. But she's my friend, not yours.
You won't do it. We're fr--
Friends help each other. They take care of each other.
I just wanted to hear your voice.
I need to talk to you.
Rebecca crumples up the paper and throws it in the trash.
Oh, man, Sara. Oh, that feels good.
Who is this guy? Why should I turn off my Blackberry and pay attention to him?
I'll tell you why -- because I hold the keys to the kingdom. Think of your favorite designers. Marc Jacobs. Vera Wang. Rick Owens.
I'm afraid we're full. But don't worry -- Intro Design has three other sections.
Tell me, Sara -- why should I sign your request form when I've turned down a dozen others? Would that be fair?
Contrary to popular opinion, beauty is not in the eye of the beholder.
Who can tell me the difference between fashion and style?
Exactly. All the money in the world can't buy you style.
Your midterm designs are due Friday. Remember, class: Simplicity. Who founded our industry? Eve -- when she handed Adam that fig leaf.
Sara. Could I see you in my office, please?
I don't think I need to tell you how impressed I've been with your work.
The college allows me to take one student. All expenses paid.
I'm saying you have a shot. You'd have to earn it, Sara.
I took a chance, that's all. With a student that I trust.
Paris, Sara. Fashion Week. Don't blow the chance of a lifetime.
You're not one of my students.
I'm sorry to hear that. But I'm not sure what I can do to help.
Look, I've always made it a policy not to accept any students this late in the term.
A few things I'd need to know.
Do you have any design experience?
What do you know about clothes?
I think we might be able to work something out.
Please don't do this. Twenty years.
Sara stares at Rebecca. No way.
Hell, I wanna be me when I grow up.
You know, your dad left me four messages last week. Making sure I'm looking out for his baby.
I told him I haven't seen you. And that for all I know you're a crack ho by now.
Sara! You can't just walk around downtown L.A. at night. This is not Des Moines.
Seriously, listen to me. That's why I own a gun.
Absolutely! Big cities are crawling with crazies.
Can't. Travel too much. Poor thing would starve to death.
Oh yeah. I went through my closet. There's nothing here I've worn in the past six months.
Oh my God, I just had the best idea.
Why don't you move in here with me?
Yeah, I'm never here. The place is huge. Ditch the roommate. And, the building allows pets.
So, how's Jason? I really liked him.
I'm sorry to stare, but you are so beautiful.
It's cinnamon. Caffeinated. A girl never knows how late she's gonna party.
The window! There's a fire escape.
She's going to be a star.
Great. Just tell me and I'll do anything.
Kiss me. I'll take it from there.
Welcome. I'm Professor Jacobs. I'll be taking over the class for the rest of the semester.
We didn't think you would make it.
It's so great to meet you, Sara.
Yeah, we think Rebecca is so talented.
That's nice to hear and I'm sure she likes you because she never brings anyone home before.
What? As a parent you worry. You protect your daughter all her life and then she goes off to college and she's on her own. I'm just relieved she got a good roommate.
Rebecca, look at me for a second.
Your mother and I are very fond of you.
I just wanted to make sure. Good night, I'm heading back to bed.
Sara, I'll make up a room for you --
Rebecca seems to be doing well.
Have a great time, you two.
Jeff opens the fridge. The soft light barely illuminates Rebecca, sitting stoically at the table behind her father.
Rebecca walks slowly down the stairs. Wincing in pain. Sara puts the phone back in her pocket and stands up.
All hands on deck -- the keg's still alive.
